response: version, account-id, interface-id, srcaddr, dstaddr, srcport, dstport, protocol, packets, bytes, start, end, action. log-status
The version of the flow log record format (e.g., 2).
The AWS account ID where the VPC is located (e.g., 123456789012).
The ID of the network interface for which the traffic is logged (e.g., eni-0abcdef1234567890).
The source IP address of the traffic (e.g., 10.0.0.10).
The destination IP address of the traffic (e.g., 172.31.22.145).
The source port of the traffic (e.g., 54321).
The destination port of the traffic (e.g., 80).
The IP protocol number (e.g., 6 for TCP).
The number of packets transferred during the aggregation interval (e.g., 10).
The number of bytes transferred during the aggregation interval (e.g., 1200).
The start time of the aggregation interval in Unix epoch seconds (e.g., 1678886400).
The end time of the aggregation interval in Unix epoch seconds (e.g., 1678886460).
The action taken on the traffic (ACCEPT or REJECT). In this case, ACCEPT indicates the traffic was allowed.
The status of the flow log record (OK, NODATA, or SKIPDATA). OK indicates the data was successfully logged.
